spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The archmage is an 14th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The archmage can cast {@spell disguise self} and {@spell invisibility} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:
footerEntries: *Rolf casts these spells on himself before combat.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The archmage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.
Rolf is a human male in his early thirties working at the Arcanist's Academy

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While Cillian is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, his AC includes his Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Cillian wears bracers of defense and carries a Tome of Internal Library and a

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Cillian makes three unarmed strikes.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
entries: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, the adept deflects the missile. The damage it takes from the attack is reduced by {@dice 2d10 + 4}. If the damage is reduced to 0, the adept catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and the adept has a hand free.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Adynor's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}). he can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or vocal components:

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Adynor has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the Adynor to sleep.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While Adynor is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, his AC includes his Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Magic Attacks
entries: Adynor's attacks are magical.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Adynor is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Adynor instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Adynor makes four attacks, up to two can be attacks with the Fang of Kanar. Alternatively he can make

action.name: Fang of Kanar
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, Adynor can choose one of the following additional effects:
The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding (Adynor's Choice).
The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of Adynor's next turn.

reaction.name: Deflect Missiles
entries: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, Adynor deflects the missile. The damage he takes from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10 + 20}

reaction.name: Slow Fall
entries: Adynor reduces the damage he takes from a fall by 75

reaction.name: Parry-Riposte
entries: In response to being attack by a melee weapon attack Adynor adds 5 to his AC, if this causes the attack to miss he can make a unarmed strike against the attacker.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when mesuapep hits with it (included in the attack)

trait.name: Speed Burst (Bonus Action)
entries: Mesuapep increases his speed by 10 feet.

trait.name: Second Wind (1/short rest)
entries: As a bonus action Mesuapep regains {@dice 1d10 + 15} HP

trait.name: Indomitable (2/day)
entries: Mesuapep rerolls a failed save.

trait.name: Action Surge (1/short rest)
entries: Mesuapep takes another action.

trait.name: Combat Maneuvers
entries: When Mesuapep hits a creature with a weapon attack, he can choose one of the following effects:
The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength Save or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength save or be pushed up to 15 feet away.
The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom Save or be {@condition frightened} untill the start of Mesuapep's next turn.

trait.name: Ring of Spellstoring
entries: Mesuapep wield a ring of spellstoring, he currently has the spell "negative energy flood" saved, with a DC of 18.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Mesuapep makes 3 weapon attacks, he can replace one of these with a strangle.

action.name: Wastebringer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Strangle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. Target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength save, on a failure the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). While {@condition grappled} the target is {@condition restrained} and Mesuapep can't use his strangle attack on another creature.

action.name: Small Mounted Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

reaction.name: Parry-Riposte
entries: In response to being attack by a melee weapon attack Mesuapep adds 5 to his AC, if this causes the attack to miss he can make a wastebringer attack against the attacker.

spellcasting.name: Warlock Spellcasting
headerEntries: Silver is a 15th level warlock, his spell casting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}) he has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Accursed Specter
entries: Any humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by Silver rises as a {@creature specter} under his control.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede silver's darkvision.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Silver makes two attacks with Voracity or shoots three Eldritch Blasts

action.name: Voracity (Longsword)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) slashing damage, or 13 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) slashing damage if used with both hands, plus 14 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) force damage.

action.name: Wrath of Voracity (1/short rest)
entries: All creatures within 30 feet of Silver must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution save, taking {@damage 8d6} necrotic damage on a fail, or half as much on a success.
Silver gains temporary hit points equal to half the total damage dealt.

reaction.name: Armor of Hexes
entries: Silver causes an attack that would've hit him to miss.

spellcasting.name: Staff of Ficilia Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Staff of Ficilia grants Lau additional spell casting (spell save {@dc 18})

spellcasting.name: Cleric Spellcasting
headerEntries: Lau is a 13th level Cleric, his spell casting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}). He has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Embodiment of the Law (5/long rest)
entries: When Lau casts a enchantment spell that costs an action, he can choose to cast it with his bonus action instead.

trait.name: Second Wind (1/short rest)
entries: As a bonus action Lau regains {@dice 1d10 + 2} HP

trait.name: Action Surge (1/short rest)
entries: Lau takes an extra action

trait.name: Stars of Ficilia
entries: Lau can use the Radiant Star action as a bonus action.

action.name: Staff of Ficilia
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Radiant Star (5 / Long Rest)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, unlimited range, one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Authority of the Former Guard Captain
entries: Lau utters a simple command, all creatures within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom save or be {@condition charmed} untill the end of Lau's next turn and follow the command.

reaction.name: Guard
entries: When a creature makes an attack roll against Lau or an ally of his within 5 ft. of him he imposes disadvantage on the attack roll.

spellcasting.name: Ranger Spellcasting
headerEntries: Night is a 15th level Ranger, his spell casting ability is Wisdom (Save {@dc 16}). He has the following spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Night's Innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom, he can cast the following spells without material components:

trait.name: Swift of Mind and Step
entries: Night ignores difficult terrain and has advantage on initiative rolls.

trait.name: Awareness
entries: Night is automatically aware of any beast, dragon or humanoid within 500 feet of him.

trait.name: Lightfooted
entries: Night can use the Dash and Disengage action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Night makes two longbow attacks or three claw attacks.

action.name: Storm Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) lightning damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Beasthide (1 / Long Rest)
entries: Night gains 30 temporary hit points and resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage for the next minute.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The weasel has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the weasel has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the weasel scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spell-Knight Spellcasting
headerEntries: Sarra's spell casting ability is Intelligence (spell {@dc 17})

trait.name: Iron-Willed
entries: Sarra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Sarra makes three melee attacks, she can replace one of these with a use of her Command.

action.name: Command
entries: Sarra commands one of her allies within 60 feet of her. That creature can use their reaction to make a weapon attack.

action.name: Frostbrand Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 5 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

Knights are warriors who pledge service to rulers, religious orders, and noble causes. A knight's alignment determines the extent to which a pledge is honored. Whether undertaking a quest or patrolling a realm, a knight often travels with an entourage that includes squires and hirelings who are commoners.

monster.name: Kxara

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Kxara is a 14th level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (Spell save {@dc 18}, +8 to hit with spell attacks) Kara has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Kxara can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Kxara fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Kxara can use her Frightful Presence. she then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales poisonous gas in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 56 ({@damage 16d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendaryHeader: Kxara can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Kxara regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Kxara makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: Kxara makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: Kxara casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Kxara casts a spell of up to 5th level.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Kxara beats her wings. Each creature within 10 feet of her must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. Kxara can then fly up to half her flying speed.

fluff.name: Adult Green Dragon

entries: The most cunning and treacherous of true dragons, green dragons use misdirection and trickery to get the upper hand against their enemies. Nasty tempered and thoroughly evil, they take special pleasure in subverting and corrupting the good-hearted. In the ancient forests they roam, green dragons demonstrate an aggression that is often less about territory than it is about gaining power and wealth with as little effort as possible.

A green dragon is recognized by its curved jawline and the crest that begins near its eyes and continues down its spine, reaching full height just behind the skull. A green dragon has no external ears, but bears leathery spiked plates that run down the sides of its neck.

A wyrmling green dragon's thin scales are a shade of green so dark as to appear nearly black. As a green dragon ages, its scales grow larger and lighter, turning shades of forest, emerald, and olive green to help it blend in with its wooded surroundings. Its wings have a dappled pattern, darker near the leading edges and lighter toward the trailing edges.

A green dragon's legs are longer in relation to its body than with any other dragon, enabling it to easily pass over underbrush and forest debris when it walks. With its equally long neck, an older green dragon can peer over the tops of trees without rearing up.

entries.name: Capricious Hunters
entries: A green dragon hunts by patrolling its forest territory from the air and the ground. It eats any creature it can see, and will consume shrubs and small trees when hungry enough, but its favorite prey is elves.

Green dragons are consummate liars and masters of double talk. They favor intimidation of lesser creatures, but employ more subtle manipulations when dealing with other dragons. A green dragon attacks animals and monsters with no provocation, especially when dealing with potential threats to its territory. When dealing with sentient creatures, a green dragon demonstrates a lust for power that rivals its draconic desire for treasure, and it is always on the lookout for creatures that can help it further its ambitions.

A green dragon stalks its victims as it plans its assault, sometimes shadowing creatures for days. If a target is weak, the dragon enjoys the terror its appearance evokes before it attacks. It never slays all its foes, preferring to use intimidation to establish control over survivors. It then learns what it can about other creatures' activities near its territory, and about any treasure to be found nearby. Green dragons occasionally release prisoners if they can be ransomed. Otherwise, a creature must prove its value to the dragon daily or die.

entries.name: Manipulative Schemers
entries: A wily and subtle creature, a green dragon bends other creatures to its will by assessing and playing off their deepest desires. Any creature foolish enough to attempt to subdue a green dragon eventually realizes that the creature is only pretending to serve while it assesses its would-be master.

When manipulating other creatures, green dragons are honey-tongued, smooth, and sophisticated. Among their own kind, they are loud, crass, and rude, especially when dealing with dragons of the same age and status.

entries.name: Conflict and Corruption
entries: Green dragons sometimes clash with other dragons over territory where forest crosses over into other terrain. A green dragon typically pretends to back down, only to wait and watch-sometimes for decades-for the chance to slay the other dragon, then claim its lair and hoard.

Green dragons accept the servitude of sentient creatures such as goblinoids, ettercaps, ettins, kobolds, orcs, and yuan-ti. They also delight in corrupting and bending elves to their will. A green dragon sometimes wracks its minions' minds with fear to the point of insanity, with the fog that spreads throughout its forest reflecting those minions' tortured dreams.

entries.name: Living Treasures
entries: A green dragon's favored treasures are the sentient creatures it bends to its will, including significant figures such as popular heroes, well-known sages, and renowned bards. Among material treasures, a green dragon favors emeralds, wood carvings, musical instruments, and sculptures of humanoid subjects.

entries.name: A Green Dragon's Lair
entries: The forest-loving green dragons sometimes compete for territory with black dragons in marshy woods and with white dragons in subarctic taiga. However, a forest controlled by a green dragon is easy to spot. A perpetual fog hangs in the air in a legendary green dragon's wood, carrying an acrid whiff of the creature's poison breath.

The moss-covered trees grow close together except where winding pathways trace their way like a maze into the heart of the forest. The light that reaches the forest floor carries an emerald green cast, and every sound seems muffled.

At the center of its forest, a green dragon chooses a cave in a sheer cliff or hillside for its lair, preferring an entrance hidden from prying eyes. Some seek out cave mouths concealed behind waterfalls, or partly submerged caverns that can be accessed through lakes or streams. Others conceal the entrances to their lairs with vegetation.

entries.name: Chromatic Dragons
entries: The black, blue, green, red, and white dragons represent the evil side of dragonkind. Aggressive, gluttonous, and vain, chromatic dragons are dark sages and powerful tyrants feared by all creatures-including each other.

entries.name: Driven by Greed
entries: Chromatic dragons lust after treasure, and this greed colors their every scheme and plot. They believe that the world's wealth belongs to them by right, and a chromatic dragon seizes that wealth without regard for the humanoids and other creatures that have "stolen" it. With its piles of coins, gleaming gems, and magic items, a dragon's hoard is the stuff of legend. However, chromatic dragons have no interest in commerce, amassing wealth for no other reason than to have it.

entries.name: Creatures of Ego
entries: Chromatic dragons are united by their sense of superiority, believing themselves the most powerful and worthy of all mortal creatures. When they interact with other creatures, it is only to further their own interests. They believe in their innate right to rule, and this belief is the cornerstone of every chromatic dragon's personality and worldview. Trying to humble a chromatic dragon is like trying to convince the wind to stop blowing. To these creatures, humanoids are animals, fit to serve as prey or beasts of burden, and wholly unworthy of respect.

entries.name: Dangerous Lairs
entries: A dragon's lair serves as the seat of its power and a vault for its treasure. With its innate toughness and tolerance for severe environmental effects, a dragon selects or builds a lair not for shelter but for defense, favoring multiple entrances and exits, and security for its hoard.

Most chromatic dragon lairs are hidden in dangerous and remote locations to prevent all but the most audacious mortals from reaching them. A black dragon might lair in the heart of a vast swamp, while a red dragon might claim the caldera of an active volcano. In addition to the natural defenses of their lairs, powerful chromatic dragons use magical guardians, traps, and subservient creatures to protect their treasures.

entries.name: Queen of Evil Dragons
entries: Tiamat the Dragon Queen is the chief deity of evil dragonkind. She dwells on Avernus, the first layer of the Nine Hells. As a lesser god, Tiamat has the power to grant spells to her worshipers, though she is loath to share her power. She epitomizes the avarice of evil dragons, believing that the multiverse and all its treasures will one day be hers and hers alone.

Tiamat is a gigantic dragon whose five heads reflect the forms of the chromatic dragons that worship her-black, blue, green, red, and white. She is a terror on the battlefield, capable of annihilating whole armies with her five breath weapons, her formidable spellcasting, and her fearsome claws.

Tiamat's most hated enemy is Bahamut the Platinum Dragon, with whom she shares control of the faith of dragonkind. She also holds a special enmity for Asmodeus, who long ago stripped her of the rule of Avernus and who continues to curb the Dragon Queen's power.

True dragons are winged reptiles of ancient lineage and fearsome power. They are known and feared for their predatory cunning and greed, with the oldest dragons accounted as some of the most powerful creatures in the world. Dragons are also magical creatures whose innate power fuels their dreaded breath weapons and other preternatural abilities.

Many creatures, including wyverns and dragon turtles, have draconic blood. However, true dragons fall into the two broad categories of chromatic and metallic dragons. The black, blue, green, red, and white dragons are selfish, evil, and feared by all. The brass, bronze, copper, gold, and silver dragons are noble, good, and highly respected by the wise.

Though their goals and ideals vary tremendously, all true dragons covet wealth, hoarding mounds of coins and gathering gems, jewels, and magic items. Dragons with large hoards are loath to leave them for long, venturing out of their lairs only to patrol or feed.

True dragons pass through four distinct stages of life, from lowly wyrmlings to ancient dragons, which can live for over a thousand years. In that time, their might can become unrivaled and their hoards can grow beyond price.
Dragon Age Categories

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the dragon takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the dragon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Grasping roots and vines erupt in a 20-foot radius centered on a point on the ground that the dragon can see within 120 feet of it. That area becomes difficult terrain, and each creature there must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the roots and vines. A creature can be freed if it or another creature takes an action to make a {@dc 15} Strength check and succeeds. The roots and vines wilt away when the dragon uses this lair action again or when the dragon dies.

A wall of tangled brush bristling with thorns springs into existence on a solid surface within 120 feet of the dragon. The wall is up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick, and it blocks line of sight. When the wall appears, each creature in its area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. A creature that fails the save takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage and is pushed 5 feet out of the wall's space, appearing on whichever side of the wall it wants. A creature can move through the wall, albeit slowly and painfully. For every 1 foot a creature travels through the wall, it must spend 4 feet of movement. Furthermore, a creature in the wall's space must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw once each round it's in contact with the wall, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Each 10-foot section of wall has AC 5, 15 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage, resistance to bludgeoning and piercing damage, and immunity to psychic damage. The wall sinks back into the ground when the dragon uses this lair action again or when the dragon dies.

Magical fog billows around one creature the dragon can see within 120 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the dragon until initiative count 20 on the next round.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region containing a legendary green dragon's lair is warped by the dragon's magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Thickets form labyrinthine passages within 1 mile of the dragon's lair. The thickets act as 10-foot-high, 10-foot-thick walls that block line of sight. Creatures can move through the thickets, with every 1 foot a creature moves costing it 4 feet of movement. A creature in the thickets must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw once each round it's in contact with the 'thickets or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage from thorns.
Each 10-foot-cube of thickets has AC 5, 30 hit points, resistance to bludgeoning and piercing damage, vulnerability to fire damage, and immunity to psychic and thunder damage.

Within 1 mile of its lair, the dragon leaves no physical evidence of its passage unless it wishes to. Tracking it there is impossible except by magical means. In addition, it ignores movement impediments and damage from plants in this area that are neither magical nor creatures, including the thickets described above. The plants remove themselves from the dragon's path.
Rodents and birds within 1 mile of the dragon's lair serve as the dragon's eyes and ears. Deer and other large game are strangely absent, hinting at the presence of an unnaturally hungry predator.

entries: If the dragon dies, the rodents and birds lose their supernatural link to it. The thickets remain, but within {@dice 1d10} days, they become mundane plants and normal difficult terrain, losing their thorns.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Alexandro's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Alexandro has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Alexandro to sleep.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of his turns, Alexandro can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, Hide or Help action.
When Alexandro uses the Help action it has a range of 30 feet.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Alexandro deals an extra 18 ({@damage 5d6}) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Alexandro that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Alexandro doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the alexandro is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the alexandro instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Alexandro makes one attack with his rapier and one with a dagger. Or he makes three attacks with his daggers if he doesn't use a bonus action.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: Alexandro halves the damage that he takes from an attack that hits him. Alexandro must be able to see the attacker.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While Orianne is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, her AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Touch of Death
entries: When Orianne brings a creature to 0 hit points, she regains 10 hit points.

trait.name: Magic Attacks
entries: Orianne's unarmed strikes are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Orianne makes three unarmed strikes.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, Orianne can choose one of the following additional effects:

items: The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding (adept's choice).
The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the adept's next turn.

action.name: Hour of Reaping (1/short rest)
entries: As an action, Orianne can force all creatures within 30 feet to make a {@dc 14} wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} untill the end of her next turn.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
entries: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, Orianne deflects the missile. The damage she takes from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10 + 10}. If the damage is reduced to 0, Orianne catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and Orianne has a hand free.

reaction.name: Slow Fall
entries: Orianne reduces the bludgeoning damage she takes from a fall by 30.

Martial arts adepts are disciplined monks with extensive training in hand-to-hand combat. Some protect monasteries; others travel the world seeking enlightenment or new forms of combat to master. A few become bodyguards, trading their combat prowess and loyalty for food and lodging.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Leanne is a 6th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). Xandala has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Ritual Caster
headerEntries: Leanne has the Ritual Caster (spell save {@dc 14})r feat and cast the following spells as rituals only:

trait.name: Subtle Spell (6/Day)
entries: When she casts a spell, she can cast it without verbal or somatic components.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands.

trait.name: Fighting Spirit (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Gerard gives himself advantage on attack rolls until the end of his turn.

trait.name: Second Wind (1/Short Rest)
entries: Gerard regains {@dice 1d10 + 6} hit points

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The veteran makes two longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of his turn, Rull can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until the start of his next turn.

trait.name: Rage (1/Short Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, Rull can enter a rage that lasts for 1 minute. The rage ends early if Rull is knocked {@condition unconscious} or if his turn ends and he hasn't attacked a hostile creature or taken damage since his last turn. While raging, Rull gains the following benefits:
He has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
He has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
When taking the attack action, he can make one more attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries: Rull can perfectly recall any path he has traveled.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Rull makes two attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when Rowan hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Hugh is a 4th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). Hugh has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Disciple of Life
entries: When Hugh casts a healing spell it heals an additional 3 hit points.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Keen Eye (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Alea can give herself advantage on an attack roll or perception check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Alea makes 2 attacks

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Dustin makes two attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The captain adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the captain must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.name: Barnes

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

languages: any two languages (usually Abyssal or Infernal)

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 13}), requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock is a 3th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: The Slasher King

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the hobgoblin can deal an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the hobgoblin that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/day)
entries: The Slasher King can reroll a failed saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Slasher King makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Shokhaar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

reaction.name: Forced Sacrifice
entries: In response to being attacked, The Slasher King can grab a small or smaller allied creature within 5 feet of him and redirect the attack to that creature.

legendaryHeader: The Slasher King can take 3 command actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Slasher King regains spent command actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Command Ally
entries: The Slasher King targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. if the target can see and hear the Slasher King, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction.

legendary.name: Frighten Foe
entries: The Slasher King targets one enemy it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear it, the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of Slasher King's next turn.

legendary.name: Reposition Allies (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Slasher King and all his allies within 30 feet can move up to 15 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.
The Slasher King is the ferocious leader of the Skull Slashers. He leads with might and is rarely alone.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The archmage is a 19th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The archmage can cast {@spell disguise self} and {@spell invisibility} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:
footerEntries: *The archmage casts these spells on itself before combat.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The archmage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

Archmages are powerful (and usually quite old) spellcasters dedicated to the study of the arcane arts. Benevolent ones counsel kings and queens, while evil ones rule as tyrants and pursue lichdom. Those who are neither good nor evil sequester themselves in remote towers to practice their magic without interruption.
An archmage typically has one or more apprentice mages, and an archmage's abode has numerous magical wards and guardians to discourage interlopers.

trait.name: Air Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Air Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Davian makes two longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

Veterans are professional fighters that take up arms for pay or to protect something they believe in or value. Their ranks include soldiers retired from long service and warriors who never served anyone but themselves.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While Niall is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Niall makes three unarmed strikes.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, Niall can choose one of the following additional effects:

items: The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding (adept's choice).
The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of Niall's next turn.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
entries: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, Hugh deflects the missile. The damage it takes from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10 + 3}. If the damage is reduced to 0, Niall catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and the adept has a hand free.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The veteran makes a longsword attack. If it has a shortsword drawn, it can also make a shortsword attack.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Mentalics)
headerEntries: Eileen's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Eileen has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Eileen to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Eileen makes two saber attacks.

action.name: Saber
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Lindwurm makes three attacks: one with its bite,

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the creatures next turn.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While Reynald is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Reynald uses shadow strike and makes an unarmed strike, or Reynald makes three unarmed strikes.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shadow Strike
entries: Reynald teleports to a creature up to 30 feet away and makes an Unarmed Strike against that creature. On a hit the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} constitution save or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the creature's next turn.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
entries: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, Reynald deflects the missile. The damage it takes from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10 + 3}. If the damage is reduced to 0, Reynald catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and the adept has a hand free.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The spy deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the spy that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the spy doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spy makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the berserker can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Tormod makes two attacks, one with his Glaive and one with the Glaive's staff.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Glaive Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The archer makes two attacks with its longbow.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Sean makes three attacks, one slam and two unarmed strikes.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. And the character must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength save or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the adept is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The adept makes three unarmed strikes or three dart attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, the adept can choose one of the following additional effects:

items: The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding (adept's choice).
The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the adept's next turn.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
entries: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, the adept deflects the missile. The damage it takes from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10 + 3}. If the damage is reduced to 0, the adept catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and the adept has a hand free.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Divine Eminence
entries: As a bonus action, the priest can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage to a target on a hit. This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If the priest expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 1st.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Combat Superiority (5/short rest)
entries: When maxwell strikes a creature, he can choose one of the following effects:
The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} strength save or drop one item it's holding(Maxwell's choice).
The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} dexterity save or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} strength save or be pushed up to 20 feet away.
The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} wisdom save or be {@condition frightened} until the end of Maxwell's next turn.

trait.name: Indomitable (1/Long Rest)
entries: Maxwell can reroll a saving throw that he fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Maxwell makes three attacks.

action.name: Shorevein
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shorevein (two-handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: As a reaction when a creature misses Maxwell with a melee attack within 5 feet, Maxwell can make one melee attack against the creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Yoshinaga makes three attacks with Raijakaijin

action.name: Raijakaijin
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) slashing damage.
